snippet: The integrity of the Police Department’s crime statistics has been questioned as accounts emerge by officers who say they are being pressured to reduce the number of felony incidents reported.
abstract: Integrity of New York City Police Dept crime statistics is being questioned as officers come forward to say they are being pressured to reduce the number of felony incidents reported; issue is particularly sensitive for the Bloomberg administrations, which has overseen a significant decline in serious felony crimes, but is fighting a public perception that the city is drifting back to a more violent era.
lead_paragraph: The integrity of the Police Department’s crime statistics has been questioned as accounts emerge by officers who say they are being pressured to reduce the number of felony incidents reported.

headline.seo: Misdemeanor or Felony? New Scrutiny of How Police Reports Classify Crime in New York City
headline.main: Police Reports Suggest Officers May Sometimes Portray Crimes Less Seriously
headline.print_headline: Police Reports Suggest Officers May Sometimes Portray Crimes Less Seriously
